page.title: 09HOUSING 2.
page.content: Very little has changed in the rural part of the area for the last hundred years.Crawford village is predominantly terraced houses with large front and rear gardens built originally for the mining community. Most are neat and tidy reflecting the pride of the villagers in their community. Some new houses are being built and others modernised. Within the Village are some large detached farm houses, semi-detached houses owned by the St. Helens Glass Company, and the Crawford Inn. In the surrounding area you have a mix of detached farmhouses, some dating back to the 17th Century and more modern brick built ones. The 'Manor House', now in a poor state of repair, is the only listed building and dates back to 17th century.
